channel.title: attack.command_and_control on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.command_and_control on My New Hugo Site

item.title: ScreenConnect Backstage Mode Anomaly
item.description: Detects suspicious sub processes started by the ScreenConnect client service, which indicates the use of the so-called Backstage mode

item.title: Query Tor Onion Address
item.description: Detects DNS resolution of an .onion address related to Tor routing networks

item.title: Tor Client or Tor Browser Use
item.description: Detects the use of Tor or Tor-Browser to connect to onion routing networks

item.title: GoToAssist Temporary Installation Artefact
item.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

item.title: ScreenConnect Temporary Installation Artefact
item.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

item.title: Anydesk Temporary Artefact
item.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

item.title: Query to LogMeIn Remote Access Software Domain
item.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

item.title: TeamViewer Remote Session
item.description: Detects the creation of log files during a TeamViewer remote session

item.title: Suspicious TeamViewer Domain Access
item.description: Detects DNS queries to a TeamViewer domain only resolved by a TeamViewer client by an image that isn’t named TeamViewer (sometimes used by threat actors for obfuscation)

item.title: Installation of TeamViewer Desktop
item.description: TeamViewer_Desktop.exe is create during install

item.title: Change User Agents with WebRequest
item.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols associated with web traffic to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic. Commands to the remote system, and often the results of those commands, will be embedded within the protocol traffic between the client and server.

item.title: Download a File with IMEWDBLD.exe
item.description: Use IMEWDBLD.exe (built-in to windows) to download a file

item.title: Suspicious SSL Connection
item.description: Adversaries may employ a known encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol.

item.title: Testing Usage of Uncommonly Used Port
item.description: Adversaries may communicate using a protocol and port paring that are typically not associated. For example, HTTPS over port 8088(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019) or port 587(Citation: Fortinet Agent Tesla April 2018) as opposed to the traditional port 443.

item.title: Suspicious Minimized MSEdge Start
item.description: Detects the suspicious minimized start of MsEdge browser, which can be used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious Diantz Download and Compress Into a CAB File
item.description: Download and compress a remote file and store it in a cab file on local machine.

item.title: AppInstaller Attempts From URL by DNS
item.description: AppInstaller.exe is spawned by the default handler for the URI, it attempts to load/install a package from the URL

item.title: Suspicious Certreq Command to Download
item.description: Detects a suspicious certreq execution taken from the LOLBAS examples, which can be abused to download (small) files

item.title: Chafer Activity
item.description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018

item.title: Netcat The Powershell Version
item.description: Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network

item.title: Ncat Execution
item.description: Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network

item.title: Default Cobalt Strike Certificate
item.description: Detects the presence of default Cobalt Strike certificate in the HTTPS traffic

item.title: Outlook C2 Registry Key
item.description: Detects the modification of Outlook Security Setting to allow unprompted execution. Goes with win_outlook_c2_macro_creation.yml and is particularly interesting if both events occur near to each other.

item.title: Wannacry Killswitch Domain
item.description: Detects wannacry killswitch domain dns queries

item.title: DNSCat2 Powershell Implementation Detection Via Process Creation
item.description: The PowerShell implementation of DNSCat2 calls nslookup to craft queries. Counting nslookup processes spawned by PowerShell will show hundreds or thousands of instances if PS DNSCat2 is active locally.

item.title: Empire UserAgent URI Combo
item.description: Detects user agent and URI paths used by empire agents

item.title: Remote File Copy
item.description: Detects the use of tools that copy files from or to remote systems

item.title: Potential Remote Desktop Connection to Non-Domain Host
item.description: Detects logons using NTLM to hosts that are potentially not part of the domain.

item.title: Notepad Making Network Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious network connection by Notepad

item.title: PwnDrp Access
item.description: Detects downloads from PwnDrp web servers developed for red team testing and most likely also used for criminal activity

item.title: Suspicious ADSI-Cache Usage By Unknown Tool
item.description: Detects the usage of ADSI (LDAP) operations by tools. This may also detect tools like LDAPFragger.

item.title: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
item.description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.

item.title: PowerShell DownloadFile
item.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: Silence.EDA Detection
item.description: Detects Silence empireDNSagent

item.title: Cisco Stage Data
item.description: Various protocols maybe used to put data on the device for exfil or infil

item.title: Malicious Payload Download via Office Binaries
item.description: Downloads payload from remote server

item.title: Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution
item.description: Execution of well known tools for data exfiltration and tunneling

item.title: High DNS Requests Rate
item.description: High DNS requests amount from host per short period of time

item.title: High DNS Requests Rate
item.description: High DNS requests amount from host per short period of time

item.title: High NULL Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of NULL record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of iodine tool execution

item.title: High TXT Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of TXT record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of Do-exfiltration tool execution

item.title: SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution
item.description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use

item.title: Crypto Miner User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by crypto miners in proxy logs

item.title: Possible DNS Tunneling
item.description: Normally, DNS logs contain a limited amount of different dns queries for a single domain. This rule detects a high amount of queries for a single domain, which can be an indicator that DNS is used to transfer data.

item.title: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

item.title: Chafer Malware URL Pattern
item.description: Detects HTTP requests used by Chafer malware

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: MsiExec Web Install
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addresses as parameter

item.title: Suspicious Certutil Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft certutil execution with sub commands like ‘decode’ sub command, which is sometimes used to decode malicious code with the built-in certutil utility

item.title: Suspicious TSCON Start as SYSTEM
item.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable (OCSP) Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable (OCSP) Profile with Typo (OSCP) in URL

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable OneDrive Browsing Traffic Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable OneDrive Profile

item.title: Suspicious DNS Query with B64 Encoded String
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries using base64 encoding

item.title: Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

item.title: Equation Group C2 Communication
item.description: Detects communication to C2 servers mentioned in the operational notes of the ShadowBroker leak of EquationGroup C2 tools

item.title: Suspicious Typical Malware Back Connect Ports
item.description: Detects programs that connect to typical malware back connect ports based on statistical analysis from two different sandbox system databases

item.title: Windows PowerShell User Agent
item.description: Detects Windows PowerShell Web Access

item.title: Windows WebDAV User Agent
item.description: Detects WebDav DownloadCradle

item.title: Activity from Anonymous IP Addresses
item.description: Detects when a Microsoft Cloud App Security reported when users were active from an IP address that has been identified as an anonymous proxy IP address.

item.title: Activity from Infrequent Country
item.description: Detects when a Microsoft Cloud App Security reported when an activity occurs from a location that wasn’t recently or never visited by any user in the organization.

item.title: Activity from Suspicious IP Addresses
item.description: Detects when a Microsoft Cloud App Security reported users were active from an IP address identified as risky by Microsoft Threat Intelligence. These IP addresses are involved in malicious activities, such as Botnet C&C, and may indicate compromised account.

item.title: Antivirus Exploitation Framework Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework

item.title: APT User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used in APT malware in proxy logs

item.title: APT40 Dropbox Tool User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent string of APT40 Dropbox tool

item.title: BabyShark Agent Pattern
item.description: Detects Baby Shark C2 Framework communication patterns

item.title: Bitsadmin to Uncommon TLD
item.description: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs - https://twitter.com/jhencinski/status/1102695118455349248 - https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/Investigating+Microsoft+BITS+Activity/23281/

item.title: CobaltStrike Malformed UAs in Malleable Profiles
item.description: Detects different malformed user agents used in Malleable Profiles used with Cobalt Strike

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable Amazon Browsing Traffic Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable Amazon Profile

item.title: DNS Tunnel Technique from MuddyWater
item.description: Detecting DNS tunnel activity for Muddywater actor

item.title: DNS TXT Answer with Possible Execution Strings
item.description: Detects strings used in command execution in DNS TXT Answer

item.title: Domestic Kitten FurBall Malware Pattern
item.description: Detects specific malware patterns used by FurBall malware linked to Iranian Domestic Kitten APT group

item.title: Download from Suspicious Dyndns Hosts
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts with dynamic DNS names (selected list)

item.title: Empty User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious empty user agent strings in proxy logs

item.title: Exploit Framework User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by exploit / pentest frameworks like Metasploit in proxy logs

item.title: File Download with Headless Browser
item.description: This is an unusual method to download files. It starts a browser headless and downloads a file from a location. This can be used by threat actors to download files.

item.title: Finger.exe Suspicious Invocation
item.description: Detects suspicious aged finger.exe tool execution often used in malware attacks nowadays

item.title: GALLIUM Artefacts
item.description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.

item.title: GfxDownloadWrapper.exe Downloads File from Suspicious URL
item.description: Detects when GfxDownloadWrapper.exe downloads file from non standard URL

item.title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators
item.description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020

item.title: Hijack Legit RDP Session to Move Laterally
item.description: Detects the usage of tsclient share to place a backdoor on the RDP source machine’s startup folder

item.title: Malware User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by malware in proxy logs

item.title: Netsh Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding (PortProxy)

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding of port 3389 used for RDP

item.title: Ngrok Usage
item.description: Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available. Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.

item.title: Outlook C2 Macro Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of a macro file for Outlook. Goes with win_outlook_c2_registry_key. VbaProject.OTM is explicitly mentioned in T1137. Particularly interesting if both events Registry & File Creation happens at the same time.

item.title: PortProxy Registry Key
item.description: Detects the modification of PortProxy registry key which is used for port forwarding. For command execution see rule win_netsh_port_fwd.yml.

item.title: Raw Paste Service Access
item.description: Detects direct access to raw pastes in different paste services often used by malware in their second stages to download malicious code in encrypted or encoded form

item.title: Suspicious C2 Activities
item.description: Detects suspicious activities as declared by Florian Roth in its ‘Best Practice Auditd Configuration’. This includes the detection of the following commands; wget, curl, base64, nc, netcat, ncat, ssh, socat, wireshark, rawshark, rdesktop, nmap. These commands match a few techniques from the tactics “Command and Control”, including not exhaustively the following; Application Layer Protocol (T1071), Non-Application Layer Protocol (T1095), Data Encoding (T1132)

item.title: Suspicious Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing
item.description: Detects a program that invoked suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

item.title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious DNS Z Flag Bit Set
item.description: The DNS Z flag is bit within the DNS protocol header that is, per the IETF design, meant to be used reserved (unused). Although recently it has been used in DNSSec, the value being set to anything other than 0 should be rare. Otherwise if it is set to non 0 and DNSSec is being used, then excluding the legitimate domains is low effort and high reward. Determine if multiple of these files were accessed in a short period of time to further enhance the possibility of seeing if this was a one off or the possibility of larger sensitive file gathering. This Sigma query is designed to accompany the Corelight Threat Hunting Guide, which can be found here: https://www3.corelight.com/corelights-introductory-guide-to-threat-hunting-with-zeek-bro-logs

item.title: Suspicious Plink Remote Forwarding
item.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel remote forarding to a local port

item.title: Suspicious Replace.exe Execution
item.description: Replace.exe is used to replace file with another file

item.title: Suspicious User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious malformed user agent strings in proxy logs

item.title: Telegram API Access
item.description: Detects suspicious requests to Telegram API without the usual Telegram User-Agent

item.title: Telegram Bot API Request
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to api.telegram.org used by Telegram Bots of any kind

item.title: Turla ComRAT
item.description: Detects Turla ComRAT patterns

item.title: Ursnif Malware C2 URL Pattern
item.description: Detects Ursnif C2 traffic.

item.title: Windows Update Client LOLBIN
item.description: Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)
